identity.name: The Midnight Altruist
identity.description: A minimalist, dark-mode daily good deed tracker that combines Google's Material You structure with a bioluminescent, deep-ocean aesthetic. It focuses on one task at a time, creating a calm, focused atmosphere.
identity.key_principle: One Good Deed, One Glowing Moment

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Install 'lucide-react' for icons, 'framer-motion' for animations, 'clsx' and 'tailwind-merge' for class management.
2. THEME: Enforce Dark Mode by default. Add 'dark' class to html/body. Set background to #050505.
3. FONTS: Import Manrope and Inter from Google Fonts in index.css.
4. LAYOUT: Create a mobile-first layout. On desktop, center the app in a phone-sized container (max-w-md) to maintain the 'personal tracker' feel.
5. INTERACTION: The 'Done' action must feel rewarding. Use a sound effect (optional) or a visual burst.
6. STORAGE: Use localStorage to persist the 'completed_dates' array and 'current_deed_index'.
7. LOGIC: The deed changes every 24h based on local time. Use a simple hash of the date to pick a deed from the list so it's consistent for the user.
8. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure text contrast is high (Light grey on Dark grey). Use aria-labels for the check button.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
